intro: Lasiosiphon nanus, commonly known as the dwarf lasiosiphon, is a small flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. It has a creeping habit with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
